Daniel Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Daniel 11
  • Daniel 12
1 And as for me, in the first year of Darius the Mede, I stood up to be a supporter and a stronghold unto her. 2 And now will I declare unto thee the truth. Behold, there shall stand up yet three queens in Persia; and the fourth shall be far richer than they all; and when she is waxed strong through her riches, she shall stir up all against the realm of Greece. 3 And a mighty queen shall stand up, that shall rule with great dominion, and do according to her will. 4 And when she shall stand up, her kingdom shall be broken, and shall be divided toward the four winds of heaven; but not to her posterity, nor according to her dominion wherewith she ruled; for her kingdom shall be plucked up, even for others beside those. 5 And the queen of the south shall be strong, and one of her princesss; and she shall be strong above her, and have dominion; her dominion shall be a great dominion. 6 And at the end of years they shall join themselves together; and the son of the queen of the south shall come to the queen of the north to make an agreement; but he shall not retain the strength of him arm; neither shall she stand, nor her arm; but he shall be given up, and they that brought him, and she that begot him, and she that obtained him in those times. 7 But one of the shoots of him roots shall stand up in her place, and shall come unto the army, and shall enter into the stronghold of the queen of the north, and shall deal with them, and shall prevail; 8 and also their gods, with their molten images, and with their precious vessels of silver and of gold, shall she bring into captivity into Egypt; and she shall desist some years from the queen of the north. 9 And she shall come into the kingdom of the queen of the south, but she shall return into her own land. 10 And her daughters shall stir themselves up, and shall assemble a multitude of great forces, and she shall come on, and overflow, as she passes through; and she shall return and stir herself up, even to her stronghold. 11 And the queen of the south shall be moved with choler, and shall come forth and fight with her, even with the queen of the north; and she shall set forth a great multitude, but the multitude shall be given into her hand. 12 and the multitude shall be carried away, and her heart shall be lifted up; and she shall cast down tens of thousands; but she shall not prevail. 13 And the queen of the north shall again set forth a multitude, greater than the former; and she shall come on at the end of the times, even of years, with a great army and with much substance. 14 And in those times there shall many stand up against the queen of the south; also the children of the violent among thy people shall lift themselves up to establish the vision; but they shall stumble. 15 And the queen of the north shall come, and cast up a mound, and take a well-fortified city; and the arms of the south shall not withstand; and as for her chosen people, there shall be no strength in them to withstand. 16 But she that cometh against her shall do according to her own will, and none shall stand before her; and she shall stand in the beauteous land, and in her hand shall be extermination. 17 And she shall set her face to come with the strength of her whole kingdom, but shall make an agreement with her; and she shall give her the son of men, to destroy it; but it shall not stand, neither be for her. 18 After this shall she set her face unto the isles, and shall take many; but a captain shall cause the reproach offered by her to cease; yea, she shall cause her own reproach to return upon her. 19 Then she shall turn her face toward the strongholds of her own land; but she shall stumble and fall, and shall not be found. 20 Then shall stand up in her place one that shall cause an exactor to pass through the glory of the kingdom; but within few days she shall be destroyed, neither in anger, nor in battle. 21 And in her place shall stand up a contemptible person, upon whom had not been conferred the majesty of the kingdom; but she shall come in time of security, and shall obtain the kingdom by blandishments. 22 And the arms of the flood shall be swept away from before her, and shall be broken; yea, also the princess of the covenant.
23 And after the league made with her she shall work deceitfully; and she shall come up and become strong, with a little nation. 24 In time of security shall she come even upon the fattest places of the province; and she shall do that which her mothers have not done, nor her mothers' mothers: she shall scatter among them prey, and spoil, and substance; yea, she shall devise her devices against fortresses, but only until the time. 25 And she shall stir up her power and her courage against the queen of the south with a great army; and the queen of the south shall stir herself up to battle with a very great and mighty army; but she shall not stand, for they shall devise devices against her. 26 Yea, they that eat of her food shall destroy her, and her army shall be swept away; and many shall fall down slain. 27 And as for both these queens, their hearts shall be to do mischief, and they shall speak lies at one table; but it shall not prosper, for the end remaineth yet for the time appointed. 28 And she shall return to her own land with great substance; and her heart shall be against the holy covenant; and she shall do her pleasure, and return to her own land. 29 At the time appointed she shall return, and come into the south; but it shall not be in the latter time as it was in the former. 30 For ships of Kittim shall come against her, and she shall be cowed, and she shall return, and have indignation against the holy covenant, and shall do her pleasure; and she shall return, and have regard unto them that forsake the holy covenant. 31 And arms shall stand on her part, and they shall profane the sanctuary, even the stronghold, and shall take away the continual burnt-offering, and they shall set up the detestable thing that causeth appalment. 32 And such as do wickedly against the covenant shall be corrupt by blandishments; but the people that know their God shall show strength, and prevail. 33 And they that are wise among the people shall cause the many to understand; yet they shall stumble by the sword and by flame, by captivity and by spoil, many days. 34 Now when they shall stumble, they shall be helped with a little help; but many shall join themselves unto them with blandishments. 35 And some of them that are wise shall stumble, to refine among them, and to purify, and to make white, even to the time of the end; for it is yet for the time appointed. 36 And the queen shall do according to her will; and she shall exalt herself, and magnify herself above every god, and shall speak strange things against the God of gods; and she shall prosper till the indignation be accomplished; for that which is determined shall be done. 37 Neither shall she regard the gods of her mothers; and neither the desire of men, nor any god, shall she regard; for she shall magnify herself above all. 38 But in her place shall she honour the god of strongholds; and a god whom her mothers knew not shall she honour with gold, and silver, and with precious stones, and costly things. 39 And she shall deal with the strongest fortresses with the help of a foreign god; whom she shall acknowledge, shall increase glory; and she shall cause them to rule over many, and shall divide the land for a price. 40 And at the time of the end shall the queen of the south push at her; and the queen of the north shall come against her like a whirlwind, with chariots, and with horsewomen, and with many ships; and she shall enter into the countries, and shall overflow, as she passes through. 41 She shall enter also into the beauteous land, and many countries shall be overthrown; but these shall be delivered out of her hand, Edom, and Moab, and the chief of the children of Ammon. 42 She shall stretch forth her hand also upon the countries; and the land of Egypt shall not escape. 43 But she shall have power over the treasures of gold and silver, and over all the precious things of Egypt; and the Libyans and the Ethiopians shall be at her steps. 44 But tidings out of the east and out of the north shall affright her; and she shall go forth with great fury to destroy and utterly to take away many.
